hook.text: Category 1 tears off shingles. Category 5 flattens neighborhoods. The scale measures devastation.

buildup.text: The Saffir-Simpson scale ranks hurricanes from 1 to 5 based on sustained wind speed.

discovery.text: Category 3 and above are called major hurricanes â€” winds exceed 178 km/h.

twist.text: Wind speed alone doesn't tell the full story. Storm surge and rainfall cause most deaths.

climax.text: Hurricane Katrina was only Category 3 at landfall but caused $125 billion in damage.

punchline.text: The number on the scale matters less than where the storm hits.

quiz.question: What does the Saffir-Simpson scale measure?
